dk.nesos.font
Class Font

java.lang.Object
  dk.nesos.font.Font

public final class Font
extends java.lang.Object

Font is an object that creates text with the BitmapFont specified in the constructor.

Author:
ndhb

Method Detail

getCharacterIndex

public int getCharacterIndex()
Returns:
first character index in the font

getFont

public BitmapFont getFont()
Returns:
the BitmapFont object associated with this font

cleanup

public void cleanup()
Releases previously allocated resources (ie. display lists and texture object).

drawText2D

public void drawText2D(java.lang.String string,
                       int x,
                       int y)
Draws the specified string at the given coordinates in orthographic projection (2D).

Transformations of the coordinate system are not preserved through this method. That is, the identity matrix is loaded, before drawing the text.

Note: The coordinates are given in OpenGL fashion, ie. (0,0) = lower-left corner of the screen

Parameters:
string -
x - coordinate
y - coordinate

drawText3D

public void drawText3D(java.lang.String string)
Draws the specified string in the 3D coordinate system.

Transformations of the coordinatesystem are preserved through this method. This makes it possible to scale, rotate and translate the text.

Parameters:
string -

renderGL

public void renderGL(int width,
                     int height)
Draws the font as one textured quad on the x-axis of the current coordinate system.

This makes examining the font easier.

Parameters:
width - of the quad being drawn
height - of the quad being drawn

getTextureName

public int getTextureName()
Provided for user to manipulate texture parameters.

Returns:
the name of the texture being used.

beginText

public void beginText()
The method saves current OpenGL states and enables those required for rendering.

Note: Should be called prior to rendering the characters in the text.

endText

public void endText()
The method restores previously saved OpenGL states.

Note: Should be called when done rendering all characters in the text.
